title: LSP4IJ camel server settings JSON schema
description: JSON schema for camel server settings.

camel.Camel catalog version.description:
The Camel catalog version used for providing Language Support for Apache Camel.

You can check available Camel catalogs at the following links: [the Maven Central repository](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/camel/camel-catalog/) and [the Maven Red Hat GA repository](https://maven.repository.redhat.com/ga/org/apache/camel/camel-catalog/).

e.g. `3.20.5` or `3.20.1.redhat-00026`

**Note:** Depending on the connection speed, it can take several minutes to have it applied.

camel.Camel catalog runtime provider.description: The Camel catalog runtime provider used for providing Language support for Apache Camel.

camel.extra-components.description: (Experimental)List of additional components to include in the Camel Catalog described with a Json list respecting Camel catalog syntax.

camel.Kafka Connection URL.description: Kafka Connection URl used by the Camel language Server to provide dynamic completion.

redhat.telemetry.enabled.description: Enable usage data and errors to be sent to Red Hat servers. Read our [privacy statement](https://developers.redhat.com/article/tool-data-collection).

camel.languageSupport.JBangVersion.description:
Apache Camel JBang version used for internal VS Code JBang commands execution. Camel JBang requirements can differ between versions, it is recommended to use `default` version to ensure all extension features work properly.

**Note**: This change will affect only commands provided by Language Support for Apache Camel extension.

camel.ls.java.home.description:
Specifies the folder path to the JDK (17 or more recent) used to launch the Camel Language Server.

On Windows, backslashes must be escaped, i.e.
"camel.ls.java.home":"C:\\Program Files\\Java\\jdk17.0_3"
